page.title: 07COAL AND OIL
page.content: Houses in Lismore have welcoming coal fires, because{coal}is the one thing actually{cheaper}than on the mainland. Coal comes from a port near a coal mine by{puffer,}and there is no coal merchant on the island. A{COAL CLUB}has two unpaid officials who order the coal and collect the money. When the{coal boat}comes in all the tractors and trailers on the island go to the pier: people collect their own coal, and deliver to those with no vehicles. The coal boat comes{once a year, usually in{May,}and its load is{120 {tons.}All coal weight is approximate. Some houses and the school have oil=fired central heating.{Oil}comes by{tanker}lorry from Oban and is much more expensive.{Diesel}for tractors comes in this way too.
